conclusion: Use the concept of work done in a thermodynamic process, given by the area under the process curve in a P-V diagram.
Identify the process from state B to state C as isobaric (constant pressure).
Pressure remains constant at 2 x 10^5 Pa; Volume changes from 2 x 10^-3 m^3 (state B) to 3 x 10^-3 m^3 (state C).
Calculate the change in volume (ΔV) as 1 x 10^-3 m^3.
Apply the work formula for an isobaric process: W = P ΔV.
Substitute the values into the work formula: W = (2 x 10^5 Pa) x (1 x 10^-3 m^3).
Calculate the work done as 200 J.
